beer.beer_description:
Double dry-hopped with Mosaic, Centennial, & Citra.

Big Love Hazy DIPA is guaranteed to make you fall head over heels. Bold and beguiling with a charming personality and huge flavor profile, this brew is a siren’s call to your taste buds. Notes of ripe mango, tropical coconut, and refreshing citrus will enchant you. Savor each sip while celebrating the big wins in life.
beer.beer_style: IPA - Imperial / Double New England / Hazy

items.badge_name: Cheers to Independent U.S. Craft Breweries (Level 85)
items.badge_description: Cheers, beer patriot! You are supporting the small and independent American craft brewer. When you see the seal -- shaped like an upside-down beer bottle -- that's independence you're tasting. Try 5 more to earn Level 86!

Celebrating Pride doesn't stop when June ends. Thanks for supporting the Queer community 365 days out of the year by checking in a beer from one of these Queer-owned and Queer-led breweries! Now keep going. Try 5 more for Level 2.

beer.beer_description: Citrus, Stone Fruit, Soft

user.bio: I like beer. I also like to take photos.

beer.beer_description: LOVE is bursting with hoppy tropical flavors. Built on a simple base of Pilsner malt and rolled oats, this super dank IPA has a pillowy mouthfeel and is double dry-hopped with Mosaic, Citra and Sabro. Flavors of mango, cantaloupe, and citrus will keep you infatuated.

items.badge_description: Your quest to quench your thirst leaves no stone unturned! That's at least That's 455 distinct venues!

beer.beer_description: LOVE is bursting with hoppy tropical flavors. Built on a simple base of Pilsner malt and rolled oats, this super dank IPA has a pillowy mouthfeel and is double dry-hopped with Mosaic, Citra and Sabro. Flavors of mango, cantaloupe, and citrus will keep you infatuated.

Indulge in the crisp refreshment of this German-style brew crafted with love and affection. Its warm golden hue will delight you, and hints of banana and clove culminate in a smooth, satisfying finish. Savor the taste of German tradition with every sip of this liquid smile. Prost to pure enjoyment.

items.badge_description: If your mash uses more than 50% wheat, you’ve got yourself a wheat beer. This diverse family includes goses, hefeweizens, American wheat ales, and more! That's 45 different beers in the "Wheat" category! Try 5 more for Level 10!

What happens when you take two or more amazing breweries, throw them into the tank and let them ferment together? An amazing collaboration beer, that’s what! Cheers to working together to create the perfect flavor. That's 100 different beers that have been brewed as a collaboration. Try 5 more for Level 21!

user.bio: Love my wife, my dogs and my beers, it's a LOVELY DAY

beer.beer_description:
West Coast IPA brewed with Mosaic Cryo, Motueka, & Enigma hops—a collaboration with Crowns & Hops, benefiting the 8Trill Initiative.

The 8Trill Initiative

There are over 9,000 craft breweries in the U.S., and around 60 of those are Black-owned. Despite making up more than 13% of the population, black ownership accounts for less than 1% of breweries.

The 8 Trillion Initiative works towards advancing racial equity in craft beer by helping to pave a path for Black-owned craft breweries.

The initiative helps to provide capital and resources to black-owned brewing companies through the 8 Trill Grant and 8 Trill Allies program.

Beny & Teo’s mission is to make the craft beer industry an example of the economic impact of achieving racial equity.

beer.beer_description: Sour red ale w/ cherries, raspberries & blackberries

German-style Lager brewed with Weyermann Barke Pilsner, Munich, and Caramunich Malts.

Light and toasty, this classic German-style Festbier knows how to party. This traditional Festbier is brewed with authentic German barley. Full of rich toasted malt flavors with a light body and refreshing crispness. It’s a party in a can, and it just might make you dance your arsch off!

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 210 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%. Try 5 more for Level 43!

At a new place and don't want to choose a pint of something you may not like? Grab a few tasters! Enjoy some small pours and then decide which to upgrade to a full pour. That's 30 checkins with the serving style of Taster. Try 5 more for Level 7! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

beer.beer_description: LOVE is bursting with hoppy tropical flavors. Built on a simple base of Pilsner malt and rolled oats, this super dank IPA has a pillowy mouthfeel and is double dry-hopped with Mosaic, Citra and Sabro. Flavors of mango, cantaloupe, and citrus will keep you infatuated.

This barrel-aged wild ale is named for our San Francisco neighborhood and pays tribute to the Flanders Red style of beer. Aged in wine barrels, this lightly tart ale is brewed with California Rainier cherries using a house blend of wild yeasts, bacteria and SF sourdough yeast. Pair this complex ale with ripe figs & blue cheese or seafood bouillabaisse.

beer.beer_style: IPA - Imperial / Double New England / Hazy
beer.beer_description: LOUD! Hazy Double IPA always uses its outside voice. Obnoxiously dry-hopped with Mosaic and Denali, LOUD! screams with tropical flavors of mango, papaya and pineapple and has a crazy hazy mouthfeel.
Sour Ale Aged In Oak Barrels With Pear Juice and Dry-Hopped With Citra, Sabro & Mosaic

This sour ale is inspired by the agricultural history of the Santa Clara Valley. Long before it became Silicon Valley, it was known as the Valley of The Heart’s Delight, a fertile basin overflowing with fruit orchards. Brewed with foraged apricots, loquats and cherries handpicked by the Garden To Table non-profit, this collaborative beer celebrates and supports their mission to promote urban farming in San Jose.
Sour red ale aged in wine barrels with cherries and whole vanilla beans.

Sour Ale aged in oak barrels with peaches & vanilla beans.

This is NOT a kettle sour! This naturally conditioned, mixed-culture sour ale was aged for months with thousands of pounds of sustainably farmed, California peaches.

This bright, tart, and super fruity space juice is out-of-this-world tasty.

Sour Ale Aged in Oak Barrels With Cherries and Vanilla Beans

This is NOT a kettle sour! This naturally conditioned, mixed-culture sour ale was aged for months with thousands of pounds of cherries. This bright, tart, and super fruity space juice is out-of-this-world tasty.

German Kölsch-Style Ale
A crisp, light and unfussy beer that makes enjoying food and friends just a little more wunderbar. Prost!

Hops: Hallertau Blanc
Malt: Cologne, Carafoam, Vienna
Sour ale aged in oak barrels with raspberries and vanilla.
Sour Ale Aged In Oak Barrels With Blackberries

Galaxy dry-hopped sour farmhouse ale aged in oak barrels with mango,
pineapple, coconut, lime, and spices.
Dry-hopped farmhouse ale aged in oak barrels with cedar spirals, passionfruit, and spices.

Hazy India Pale Ale Dry-Hopped With Cashmere & Simcoe

Baby, it's hella cold outside. Bunny Hill Hazy IPA has a pillowy-soft mouthfeel like freshly fallen snow. This liquid snowflake is dry-hopped with an avalanche of Cashmere and Simcoe creating notes of citrus zest and ripe melon.
West Coast IPA dry-hopped with Simcoe and Centennial

Coffee Stout Brewed With Coffee and Vanilla Beans

BOOST is a bold and decadent stout turbocharged with coffee and vanilla beans. We partner with a new coffee roaster for each batch. You can check the canning date on your can to learn more about our awesome coffee partners!

ABV: 9.0%

Can Date: December 2022- Timeless Coffee

Can Date December 7-8, 2021- Boast Coffee

Can Date November 10-11, 2021- Bicycle Coffee Co.

Can Date: December 22, 2020- Proyecto Diaz

Can Date: December 2, 2020- Boast Coffee

Can Date: December 1, 2020- Bicycle Coffee Co.

Can Date: November 24, 2020- Boast Coffee

Can Date: October 22- November 17, 2020- Alchemy Collective
Hazy IPA dry-hopped with rotating hops.
Sour ale aged in oak barrels with apricots & vanilla beans.

Future Is Fluid is A West Coast IPA dry-hopped with Mosaic, Sabro, Simcoe, and Cashmere brewed by the women of Almanac Beer in support of the Pink Boots Society, a nonprofit that creates training and educational opportunities for women working in beer! Cheers to a more inclusive, equitable, and fluid future.
Sour Blonde Ale Aged in Bourbon Barrels with Peaches.
Sour blonde ale aged in Oak Foudres with raspberries, blueberries & cherries
Sour farmhouse ale aged with merlot grapes, rose hips & rose petals.
Sour red ale with currants aged in wine barrels

German-style Lager brewed with Weyermann Barke Pilsner, Munich, and Caramunich Malts.

Light and toasty, this classic German-style Festbier knows how to party. This traditional Festbier is brewed with authentic German barley. Full of rich toasted malt flavors with a light body and refreshing crispness. It’s a party in a can, and it just might make you dance your arsch off!
Sour ale aged in oak barrels with blueberries.
